title: Creating a reading list of 20 articles on meaning representation for natural language up to 2024 involves selecting a mix of foundational, recent, and influential works in the field. Here’s a list that includes a variety of perspectives and approaches
**"WordNet: An Electronic Lexical Database"** by George A
A foundational resource for understanding lexical semantics
Discusses the limitations and potential of distributional semantics
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
Introduces BERT, a model that has significantly influenced meaning representation
**"A Survey on Contextual Embeddings"** by Matthew Peters et al
Reviews the development and impact of contextual embeddings like ELMo
**"Universal Dependencies: A Cross-Linguistic Perspective"** by Joakim Nivre et al
Explores a framework for consistent syntactic annotation across languages
**"The Role of Syntax in Vector Space Models of Compositional Semantics"** by Edward Grefenstette et al
Examines how syntax can be integrated into vector space models
**"Semantic Role Labeling: Past, Present and Future"** by Lluís Màrquez et al
A comprehensive overview of semantic role labeling techniques
**"A Structured Distributional Semantic Model for Event Co-Reference"** by Nathanael Chambers and Dan Jurafsky
Discusses a model for understanding event co-reference in text
**"The Meaning Factory: Formal Semantics for Recognizing Textual Entailment and Determining Semantic Similarity"** by Johan Bos and Katja Markert
Explores formal semantics in the context of textual entailment
**"Compositional Distributional Semantics with Long Short Term Memory"** by Kai Sheng Tai et al
Introduces LSTM models for compositional semantics
**"A Survey of Word Embeddings in Natural Language Processing"** by Tomas Mikolov et al
Reviews the development and application of word embeddings
**"Semantic Parsing with Neural Networks"** by Jonathan Berant et al
Discusses the use of neural networks for semantic parsing
**"Towards a Universal Semantic Representation"** by Sebastian Riedel et al
Proposes a framework for universal semantic representation
**"The Role of Pragmatics in Meaning Representation"** by Dan Sperber and Deirdre Wilson
A classic work on the importance of pragmatics in understanding meaning
**"Neural Machine Translation by Jointly Learning to Align and Translate"** by Dzmitry Bahdanau et al
Introduces the attention mechanism, crucial for meaning representation in translation
**"A Survey on Semantic Parsing"** by Percy Liang
Provides an overview of semantic parsing techniques and challenges
**"The Representation of Meaning in Memory"** by Allan Paivio
A classic psychological perspective on meaning representation
**"Learning Semantic Representations of Users and Products for Document Level Sentiment Classification"**
Discusses semantic representation in the context of sentiment analysis
**"From Word Embeddings to Document Distances"** by Matt Taddy
Explores the use of word embeddings for measuring document similarity
**"A Survey on Recent Advances in Natural Language Inference"** by Samuel R
Reviews recent progress in natural language inference, a key area for meaning representation
These articles cover a range of topics from foundational theories to cutting-edge research, providing a comprehensive overview of meaning representation in natural language processing
